intro: Calcitrapoides micracantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed calcitrap, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often subtended by bracts. It is adapted to survive in drought conditions, with deep roots and reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. Calcitrapoides micracantha is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
